betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome to §d§5§5Gregg§d§5enuity!
§b(Version 0.07A)

§fAs with any other pack, your first priority in a strange new land should be creating a simple starter base. For that, you'll probably want §5§5§0§f§e§fsome tools §f- best start with some §eFlint Tools§e§f, considering §cvanilla tools are disabled.

§fA sword to defend yourself, a pickaxe to begin prospecting, and an axe to get quick wood should probably be your first priorities.

(Note: the Void Satchel allows you to automatically void what you set it to.)

Ore deposits form in large clusters instead of scattered throughout caves as per vanilla. Additionally: there are many methods to obtain the same material. For example, both §eYellow Limonite§f and §7§4§eBasaltic Mineral Sand§f can be smelted into §7§eIron.§f Acquainting yourself with the Material Byproducts §cJEI §ftab and the World Generation §cJEI §ftab will be invaluable.

Additionally: some ores, and ores in their most simplest form are usually only found with Immersive Engineering Ore Deposits. For now though, they're not essential to your progression.

What §ois §o§o§ressential to your progression right now is §eIron, §8§7Coal, §6Copper, §fand Tin. So you should probably search for those.

§bTip: §f§aBotania §fflowers can §lonly §rspawn near an ore-vein. §cJEI §fcan tell you which flower correlates to which ore vein. Additionally, there'll be a note in the top left if you're in a valid ore chunk, since they spawn in a grid.)

A lot of GregTech recipes, as well as recipes that have been "Greggified" (remade to use GT components) use a lot of crafting tools. Here are some of the tools you'll be using.

Wrenches can be used to break machines, rotate them, as well as rotate their outputs. GregTech wrenches are compatible with most every other type of mod present in the pack - so no more 10 wrenches cluttering up your inventory. They're additionally used for making connections on item pipes and fluid pipes.

In addition to being necessary for making plates, Hammers can be used as a mining tool to automatically crush your ores.

Screwdrivers can be used to configure GT machine covers.

Axes won't cut logs if you sneak while using them.

And lastly: wire-cutters are used to create and sever connections between GT cables & wires.

1x1 mining is §oso §r2010s - 3x3 mining is the future. It's a good thing GregTech mining hammers mine in a 3x3 radius - but, they do use durability faster as a result. You'll probably want a few of them.

Necessary not only for cables, but for a plunger and soft-mallet as well. You're going to need a lot of this - though, you only have the bad alloy smelter recipe at the moment.

§9§bTip:§f Blaze Powder can be turned into Tiny Piles of Sulfur Dust. You can get Blaze Powder from Fel Pumpkins, or from Cinderpearls.

While these tools are more niche, they still have their value and purposes.

Plungers can be used to clear fluids from a machine.
Crowbars can be used to pry covers or facades off.
And soft-hammers can be used to stop a machine from working entirely.

Which assures this pack is well-balanced.

Working towards a Mason Table should be your priority after you find your footing. You may also want to search for a large source of lava.

Coke, or coke coal, is twice as effective as regular coal - though, significantly harder to make. Not only that, but it's required for making both §4§7Wrought Iron §fand §8Steel §fwithout access to power, so you'll want quite a bit of it. 

To make it, you'll need a §eCoke Oven. §fYou'll want quite a bit of clay and red sand for this. If you're having difficulty finding §c§fred sand, you can craft some using §6Copper §f& §cRedstone§f - though it's probably best to avoid this as much as you can. Consider using a §aNature's Compass.

§fYou'll also want something to pipe your creosote into, so I've taken the liberty of giving you something.

§bTip: §fIt's best to make Coke by the block - it's about 11% more efficient.

Not only is §e§7Wrought Iron§f stronger and more durable than regular iron - it's also an essential component towards making your first steps towards voltage. §eSteam Machines§f require a lot of Wrought Iron per, and it's also an essential component in creating §d§5§dThaumium§f or §8§7Steel.§f§f The short of it is that you're probably going to want a lot of it.

The unfortunate side effect is that you're going to need a lot of Coke for that. How about you start with a stack, and I'll match you with a half-stack of Coke?
And finally, your source of steel. There's not much to say here. Apart from the fact that after you create steel, the world will start growing more dangerous. So, be careful of that.
Your best friend for the forseeable future. Not only is it essential to create glass and therefore other machines, it also unlocks a much more efficient recipe for Wrought Iron.

And with that, you've officially entered the Low Voltage age. 

You're going to need a lot of this. You know the drill by now - start with a stack.

If your only experience is Thaumcraft 4 or prior, it might be best to watch a guide to get a grasp of the basics. If your only experience is Thaumcraft 5, then I don't believe you.

§l§e§lThaumcraft is §4§lNOT§e §lmandatory for progression.§f

...but it is highly beneficial - giving you access to powerful fuel, strong utility tools, infinite water pre-HV, and often quicker or higher yield recipes. 

To get started in Thaumcraft, you're going to need to find a Mystic Heat Vein and a Mystic Cold Vein, marked by Cinderleaf and Shimmerleaf respectively. From there, you'll need to hammer down some Vis Crystals into their shards, then further grind it down into Salis Mundus along with Pig Iron. After that - sprinkle some on a bookcase, and you're set and ready.

Not only is Nitor a top choice for an aesthetic light source, it also serves as a mandatory step in Thaumcraft progression and a much more convenient heating source for your cauldron than lava.

It may also have its uses here or there in §1§9Astral Sorcery,§f or other Magichem. 

Why magenta nitor specifically as the quest icon and reward? Because it's a nice color.

The ultimate storage solution, accessible to you as early as LV. While it can't quite store as much as its other competitors - like §6Thermal Foundation's §6§eCache,§f or §bGregTech's §§§b§eQuantum Chest§r, Storage Drawers provide an option that is cheaper, earlier, much more modular, and much more convenient.

Not only that, but this pack includes §bFluid Drawers, §fallowing you to store fluids in a drawer system. With this, as well as using trim and controller slaves to expand your automation setups, you can make very compact and visually appealing setups. You don't normally have access to them just yet - but your first dose is free.

Unfortunately, it looked like someone disabled default drawers. I guess you're going to need a framing table to match them to your base palette now. Shucks.

§a§o(...you aren't lawnbasing, right?)

Thaumium is not only a powerful tool material, but it also makes for a powerful cabling option, a path to quicker steel in the PBF, and a stepping stone to a more convenient LV Superconductor.

As a reward for getting some Thaumium, I'll spare you some microcrafting.
No Description
Low voltage, big dreams.
Mo' voltage mo' problems.
Now the game begins.
Your guide to everything fun and useful you might miss.
